title: Erin Molan's fiancé Sean wore a sling in hospital to make her 'feel a bit better' after nasty fall
text:
Erin Molan policeman fiancé, Sean Ogilvy, has been wearing a sling in hospital to make the Channel Nine star 'feel a bit better' after she broke her arm and hand following a nasty fall.

Radio star Alan Jones said on his 2GB Breakfast Show this week that Sean made the gesture in a bid to cheer his bride-to-be up as she recovers from her injury.

Alan said that he had been speaking to Erin, who is in 'excruciating pain.'

'It didn't work but she thought it wasn't a bad gesture': Erin Molan's fiancé Sean Ogilvy wore a sling in hospital to make her 'feel a bit better'... after suffering a nasty fall and breaking her arm and hand

'I know that Sean her partner, wore a sling in hospital just to make her feel a bit better,' Alan said.

'It didn't, but she thought it wasn't a bad gesture. I saw the pictures, it's a brutal break.'

Injured: She suffered a nasty fall and spent 10 days in hospital after breaking her arm and hand

Erin, 36, told her Weekend Edition co-host, Natalie Peters, that she hopes to be back at work soon, but is still in pain.

'It's very painful, one of the more painful breaks you can do but my attitude is always "it could've been so much worse" so I live another day,' Erin said.

She added that it's 'probably more painful for Sean.'

Nasty fall: Erin meanwhile told her Weekend Edition co-host Natalie Peters that she hopes to be back at work soon but is still in pain

'He's already sick to death of me. No, he's been amazing, he honestly has. We got a 16-month-old... it's tough for him having to do everything.'

Erin spent 10 days in hospital after breaking her arm and hand in a horrific accident at home.

The Channel Nine sports reporter tripped and fell as she walked downstairs during the night to fetch a bottle for her daughter Eliza.

'He's already sick to death of me': She added that it's 'probably more painful for Sean'

The blonde has now returned home to rest and will continue to miss work duties until she's made a full recovery, Nine News reported.

Her absence from Nine and her radio show came amid claims she had been sidelined by the network due to reported feud with Andrew Johns.

The 45-year-old 'doesn't like working with her', a television source told Daily Mail Australia earlier this month.

Painful: The Channel Nine sports reporter tripped and fell as she walked downstairs during the night to fetch a bottle for her daughter Eliza

The source said Johns' biggest gripes were that Molan giggled and spoke over him and other Nine personalities when they were talking about football.

Another source close to Johns said he did not know when the problems between the pair began but the footballing great would not be backing down.

A Channel Nine spokeswoman said claims Molan was sidelined by the network during the NRL Grand Final were 'clearly another beat up about Erin'.

Victoria Buchan told The Daily Telegraph: 'Erin hosted the first three hours of the (grand final) coverage on the day from the ground and did all the post-show interviews with the families of the winning teams.'
description: Erin Molan suffered a nasty fall and spent 10 days in hospital after breaking her arm and hand.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
